address.streetAddress: 60 Simcoe St at the Roy Thomson Hall

description: Founded in 1922, the Toronto Symphony Orchestra is one of Canada’s leading cultural institutions. Today, more than 225,000 patrons and over 50,000 students visit the Orchestra at Roy Thomson Hall each year, and an additional five million Canadians tune in to concert broadcasts on CBC Radio. Under the leadership of Music Director Peter Oundjian, the Orchestra has increased recording and touring projects to include a self-produced record label, and performances throughout the US and Canada. The Orchestra continues to develop its international presence by being an active commissioning body for new Canadian and international works, as well as attracting distinguished guest artists and conductors to performances at Roy Thomson Hall.

reviews.title: Christmas Tradition
text: A wonderful Christmas concert. Less traditional Christmas standards than 2022 but stellar performances! A a family of 9 adults and a young teen, this is an annual family tradition. Parking underground is very convenient.

reviews.title: Great concert
text: It had been some time since we last heard the TSO play, and Sunday afternoon's concert was a splendid reintroduction. The conductor was Tarmo Peltokoski, a 22-year-old (!) Filipino-Finnish maestro who gave an excellent and energetic account of himself. The first piece was a brief and rather dreamy piece by Kaija Saariaho. This was followed by a spirited rendition of the Brahms Violin Concerto, with the TSO's concert master Jonathan Crow as the soloist. He performed splendidly, as did the orchestra. The post-intermission work was Shostakovich's 5th Symphony, which was suitable noisy in places and highly listenable throughout. Well done, TSO!

reviews.title: Performance Brought Me To Tears
text: The recent TSO concert program that included flawless orchestral performances culminated in the Tchaikovsky Violin Concerto in D Major, Opus 35. Peter Oundjian conductor.

Oundjian spoke about meeting Guest Artist Timothy Chooi during a visit to The Juilliard School. He quipped that he’s often told, “You have to hear this violinist,” when that’s not often the case. But that the encounter with Chooi made him  want to bring him to perform with the TSO. Didn’t hurt either that Chooi is Canadian.
Covid wreaked havoc with the original performance dates, but finally it came to pass.
Over many years I’ve heard the “violin greats” perform this evocative concerto - from Isaac Stern, to Itzhak Perlman, and Joshua Bell.
There’s a new kid in the block who must be added to that stellar roster. Chooi’s mastery brought me to tears!
Thank you Oundjian for showcasing this remarkable talent. I only wish it was allowed to photograph him in action.

reviews.title: Nice Orchestra Experience
text: This was my first orchestra experience and I very much enjoyed it. I attended the Beethoven Symphony Orchestra and it was very much pleasing to the ears.

reviews.title: Great Venue and Great Music
text: I went with two teenagers to see the symphony. They were performing works by American composers. The orchestra is an excellent group of very talented musicians. The venue has amazing acoustics and the program was very well thought out and orchestrated. Definitely a good place to go to see world class musicians

reviews.title: Great since many years
text: I have been there for many years and the experience is great
Went with my kids since they are 5 years old
Reasonable prices
Good customer service

reviews.title: Better than outstanding!
text: Star Wars - Return of the Jedi, In Concert, October 4, 2019 at Roy Thomson Hall, Steven Reineke conductor.

This was the first of two cine-concerts (live orchestra playing the music score synchronized to the film onscreen) that the TSO is doing this season (the other is in May 2020). It was an amazing experience! Reineke opened by inviting the audience to cheer, boo, hiss at their favourite moments in the picture, and to occasionally watch the orchestra working hard (they played continuously for the last hour per John Williams score). RTH even made the evening more friendly by allowing drinks and snacks inside the auditorium (how civilized can we become?).

All things considered, the evening, along with Reineke's extraordinary energy made for a fantastic evening appropriate for all ages who would normally watch the movie. The orchestra and Reineke were accorded an extended standing ovation at the end of the performance (one of those rare times where everyone stays until the credits have finished).
Well done TSO and Reineke!

reviews.title: First Experience
text: Having never been to see the Toronto Symphony Orchestra perform, I didn't know what to expect.  I am a lover of most all music and our visit provided a great variety. Our performance also involved dancers providing dances suitable to the genres. The music and performances were wonderful. The conductor was very interactive with the audience and explained the music being performed.  It was a great first experience and I would definitely go again.

reviews.title: Great night out!
text: First time seeing them at Roy Thomson Hall.  Was a great evening.  Seating was very comfortable and a very interesting building.

reviews.title: Great concert!
text: My husband and I enjoy seeing other city symphonies whenever we travel. We are used to a large symphony in our home town. TSO is a small symphony, but gives off a great sound. We enjoyed seeing them. If we're ever back in Toronto we would definitely see them again.

reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Well worth the visit
text: The TSO was fantastic - we always like visiting the arts while traveling and this was no disappointment. Reasonably priced, but not at the expense of the performance. And there wasn't a bad seat in the venue. Excellent visit

reviews.title: Saint-Saens Organ Symphony
text: Once again, I was delighted to attend a new TSO concert. Each time I go, it's always a special experience. This time, we had an encore interpretation of Cohen's Hallelujah on the piano played by Italian pianist Stefano Bollani. Simply beautiful and memorable. Thanks to all TSO musicians to bring such musical music. It warms the heart especially when it gets colder outside.

reviews.title: Best Symphony Orchestra in Toronto and area
text: As a local and lover of classical music, I discovered the symphony later on after my stay in Toronto.

Long story short, this is the best symphony orchestra in town and definitely one of the better ones on the continent. If you're a classical music lover or like the symphony, you should not miss a chance at a show here.
This place is worth a subscription for classical music fans.

If you catch a show in Roy Thomson Hall, even better, since the building has VERY good acoustics, having spent lots of money to get it to that state. Also, the decor inside the building and inside the hall is very nice. They have good bars for intermission.

Be aware: Tickets to the shows, especially the big ones (Beethoven, Bach, etc.) sell out quickly, so if you want good seats to a performance (or any seats at all in some cases), definitely buy as early as possible.

reviews.title: TSO + Second City was soooo much fun!
text: Visited for TSO + Second City and the show was hilarious! Definitely planning to come back for this next year. I think TSO is doing a great job trying to appeal to a wider audience. If you are under 35, check out TSO soundcheck!

reviews.title: Tribute to John Williams excellent
text: We were so happy to hear that the TSO would be performing a tribute to our favourite movie composer, John Williams. We immediately purchased tickets for the first night.
Listening to the performance, as avid movie buffs, was like listening to the soundtrack of our lives. Their performance of the music from ET: the Extra Terrestrial actually brought tears to my eyes.

Kudos to them for being the first orchestra to perform the music from the new Star Wars movie. The curtain call performance of the Cantina music from the first Star Wars movie was a wonderful surprise.
My husband was hoping to hear the Superman music as well, but we understand that you couldn't play it all in two hours.
Great job! We are now hoping for a Jerry Goldsmith, John Barry or Howard Shore concert.

reviews.title: Great performance
text: It is a great and friendly venue.  Great orchestra and nice program this year.  Enjoyed many performances this season.   Still a few concerts throughout June.

reviews.title: Heard better
text: We have been TSO subscribers for a number of years, and usually enjoy the various performances, branching out from my comfort level with pops concerts to more classical performances. Maybe with my taste for classical I was expecting too much, but just not impressed with the Music of John Williams. Williams must be doing something right having composed music for close to 80 movies, gaining 50 Academy Award nominations but here, with Steven Reineke as conductor, just couldn't wait for it to get over.

reviews.title: Not to be missed
text: TSO offers a full range of concerts from pop to heavy classics. Many pricing options are available and you wont be disappointed. We went last night to "Angela Hewitt plays Bach" and were blown away by her performance. After the interval we were treated to the full orchestra performing Shostakovich's Symphony No. 8 and conducted by Peter Oundjian. Just amazing experience that will stay with us for some time. TSO is a must visit a few times per year. wish I lived closer as I would be a more frequent visitor.

reviews.title: TSO should detail song selection on website
text: My wife purchased tickets to a Pops TSO concert entitled "On Broadway".  There was no song list on the website, and we both expected to hear all the old Broadway classics; anything by Rogers and Hammerstein, Miss Saigon, Wicked, Les Miz, My Fair Lady, Sound of Music, etc.  Instead, we had to endure some of the most obscure songs from off-Broadway productions. Had we known the song list, we would never have bought the tickets....and my wife and I have been regular TSO attendees for at least 25 years and this was one of the few poor evenings there.

reviews.title: Simply Wow!
text: What a wonderful symphony orchestra! We went to see from Mozart to Rachmaninoff performance in February and were amazed by the true talent from the conductor to the orchestra. Definitely I recommend it to assist if you want to be impressed!

reviews.title: TSO Home Alone with Choir from Etobicoke School for the Arts (ESA)
text: We attended because our grand daughter sings with the ESA choir and wanted to see her perform with the TSO. Unfortunately we found out too late she couldn't sing the night we had tickets for. Nevertheless we chose to attend and thoroughly enjoyed the music and the evening as a whole. Given the Home Alone movie was being screened as part of the performance with the TSO playing the  background music, I think it would have been enjoyed by very young children with a nice intro to symphony music in the process. The ESA choir didn't start to sing until after the intermission, but were amazingly good and received loud and unanimous applause for each song they performed. There was a minor glitch where the picture on the screen went dark for 5 minutes or so - just the sound, but that was when the choir was singing so it wasn't a disaster and the picture returned to great applause as well. All in all an enjoyable evening.

reviews.title: TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE - WILL NEVER ATTEND
text: I bought tickets for a show last year in December. We confused the day the show was on and showed up the day after our tickets expired. We ended up buying new tickets but was assured by the TSO that we could redeem the 2 tickets for another show the following year. Now that it about a month to December, I called them to redeem my tickets and got told that the tickets can only be redeemed during the 2016/2017 season which ended in September. I went on to explain that I understood their original reassurance to mean that I could redeem the tickets in the next "year" which to me meant until December 2017. TSO management called me and refused to make any sort of amendment to this rule. I have essentially paid them over $120 in two tickets for free.

This is a very disappointing and categorically unethical practice for such an institution. As I mentioned to the manager I spoke to, this is akin to tactics one would expect from a sleezy second had car salesman. Very very disappointed and will never go to the TSO again.

reviews.title: Very enjoyable!
text: First trip to the TSO was great.  The seats were good, getting in the venue was easy and the acoustics are great.
The only thing I would complain about was the guest Conductor should keep his politics to himself.  I'm there to listen to great music not your thoughts on heads of states of other countries...

reviews.title: Mozart  and Mendelssohn Choir
text: My husband and I are members of the TSO.
The TSO offers a plethora of shows and varietal in nature.  Recently we have seen Second City does the Symphony, 12 days of Christmas, Abba, Mozart and the Mendelssohn Choir to name a few.
There is never a disappointment.  They have exceptional talent at all levels and all musicians.

The membership offers great perks including no service charge, access to certain restaurants in the area with a discount, great prices on tickets, the ability to switch tickets in advance if there is a conflict with the evening you've selected.
The Mendelssohn choir is bar none.  I've seen this group on a few occasions and they are outstanding.
The conductors have great personalities.  They are comedic, they do a great job describing the pieces that will be played out and they do a lovely job in engaging the audience.
Something to consider if you love the Orchestra.

reviews.title: Finally
text: I have been complaining for years that the guest performers for the Pops concert series at the TSO features American singers, so it was a delight that not only were the two singers - Chilina Kennedy and Ryan Silverman -  Canadians, but so was the choir, the 100-plus voices of the Amabile Choirs of London.

reviews.title: great orchestra !
text: I often go to hear the TSO, and I am fortunate to be in a choir that sometimes sings with the TSO.
The variety of repertoire performed, the high level of musicianship, the talented Peter Oundjian make this orchestra a must to see and hear again and again!

reviews.title: Amazing
text: Went to see a performance and was just in awes about it all .Was really a wonderful day . Well forth it .The  Orchestra in my opinion  is the worlds best. Loved it .

reviews.title: Make time to visit TSO
text: We recently attended "Messiah" at the Toronto Symphony. The choir alone was 125 people and another 30 violins and other instruments and 4 soloists. A superb world class performance!
The production was excellent and the conductor put so much feeling and life into it, that it became an emotional experience.
The acoustics are so good, it feels like you will hear a penny drop on the stage and it carries every note, pure and clear to you.
TSO is something we all should visit from time to time. It is a soul cleansing and uplifting experience!

reviews.title: Such a wonderful concert with Itzhak Perlman
text: We were so fortunate to attend a recent performance of the TSO with Mr Perlman at Massey Hall . He is such a wonderful example of truimph over polio adversity and his music is so beautiful. When he returns make a point of getting tickets the venue is spectacular and easy to get to , as well..

reviews.title: The Twelve Days of Christmas
text: It was fantastic to see for many young people at a TSO concert, and this year's Twelve Days of Christmas was an ideal setting to expose youngsters to a symphonic experience. And what a way for the TSO to set the stage for the Christmas season,  with Colin Mochrie narrating the Twelve Days of Christmas, complete with 11 pipers piping. Fascinating night of music.

reviews.title: Great evening and super orchestra with relaxed dress code
text: We love visiting different symphonies around the world when we travel so looked forward to Toronto’s symphony.  We were not disappointed!  It was so easy to get to by the subway and the underground walkway.  There were lots of restaurants just a block away for pre-show dining.  (Kit Kat was good but crazy busy!)  The hall is beautiful and I found acoustically well balanced.  I had fretted over which seating section might be the best and had asked advice of the symphony’s telephone sales agent.  Since there was a violin concerto, she recommended right orchestra so we would be facing her directly.  It was a good choice.  However, generally, it seemed to me that all of the seats in the house except perhaps the back orchestra under the balcony would be good.  If you like watching the trombones, go for the balcony.  Also, I wondered how they dressed.  I put on a tie.  Wasted effort.  Didn’t see three others with ties.  Just grab a jacket and go.  It’s a great orchestra!

reviews.title: Suitable orchestra for a world-class city
text: The TSO has maintained a strong level of performance in recent years as it experiences changes in its conductor. It can produce a fierce sound when it lets loose on prominent Romantic pieces despite a somewhat smaller size than would be appropriate; it is also capable of very delicate work on more modernist rep. The string section sometimes lacks body though the middle and is can be overpowered by the woodwind and brass sections. A minor complaint is the fidgety horn players; the trombone and trumpet sections seem perfectly capable of sitting still during rests but the horn players were quite noticeable constantly emptying, adjusting, or raising earlier than their section-mates. Also, disappointing that the male performers are now just wearing suits and ties.

reviews.title: Superb musicianship
text: Atop the classical music pinacle in Toronto, indeed Canada, is the TSO. It has been a long, slow climb, but the orchestra has finally come into its own. Under Maestro Andrew Davis, the TSO built a solid core of players. In the past 13 years under Peter Oundjian, it has added a suite of superb young principal players. The result is an ensemble that can hold its own with the best. One of the best values for your entertainment dollar in the city - consistently excellent.

reviews.title: Beautiful theatre, great orchestra
text: Great orchestra, beautiful theatre in downtown Toronto. Very lively. Different types of shows. you can combine the Concert with dining in one of the many restaurants nearby

reviews.title: World class entertainment 🎶 in a clean safe city
text: What good fortune we had to attend a concert of the TSO at the George Weston Concert Hall in Toronto. The venue is intimate although we prefer the acoustics at Roy Thomson Hall where concerts are usually held.

Sir Andrew Davis was conducting. The concert featured Sibelius’ Symphony #5, and a Max Bruch violin concerto with outstanding violinist Raymond Chen. Chen connected with the audience in a way we have rarely experienced and his two unexpected encores further highlighted his talent.
If you are visiting Toronto and are a classical music fan, a TSO concert is a must.

reviews.title: First visit - wonderful performance!
text: While visiting Toronto, seeing the TSO was high the list. My friend who now resides in Toronto, was my VSO buddy for the last few years. The Roy Thomson Hall is beautiful and the acoustics are superior to VSO’s location. Last night we were delighted with the sounds of Brahms and Rachmaninoff. We sat towards the back of the Orchestra section and the view was excellent. After the event the ushers were giving directions to parking and the subway freely. Great night!

reviews.title: Excellence and consistency
text: We have been subscribers for many years and yet never considered reviewing this world class ensemble .

Many individually talented performers (today it was the harpist) working together in pieces more or lesser known. My best memory still the very recent show for Remembrance Day. Unforgettable. thanks for making toronto great

reviews.title: Wonderful music!
text: My husband and I have been subscribers for a number of years, and try to go to as many concerts as possible when we are in town. Their programs are wonderful, their guests conductors are world known and admired, and our in-house conductor for the last 10 years have inspired the musicians to the higher excellence!! We both love sitting in our regular seats, and the moment the lights go down, I enter a magical world!!
Thanks so much TSO for so many wonderful evenings!!!

reviews.title: Always amazing
text: It is always enjoyable to attend. Last time we went this December to The Best of Tchaikovsky. Nice venue and great symphony.

reviews.title: Must see and Hear
text: Please enjoy this wonderful symphony.  It is conveniently located to the subway and streetcar lines, and is a treasure to hear and see.
